title: LedgerLive integration for Optimism
body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Ledger live does not natively support OE and interacting with Optimism using Ledger can only be done via MetaMask with the so called "blind signing" in Ledger which makes for overall sub par UX. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Initially this issue should aim to research the [available Ledger integration options](https://developers.ledger.com/docs/dapp/process/) and provide a recommendation for the possible integrations. Once we have a proposal we'll discuss and agree internally what is the best way forward and fund one or more separate issues for the execution of each approved proposal.

**Additional context**
[Optimism help desk page for Ledger support](https://help.optimism.io/hc/en-us/articles/4412661300507-Can-I-use-the-Ledger-wallet-with-Optimism-) 

Additionally there has been a reported user problem with transaction failing because Ledger is setting bad gas limit. Eventually the transactions are reported to go through when users try again.

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 200.0 USDC (200.0 USD @ $1.0/USDC) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-optimism/optimism/2087/100027550). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-optimism/optimism/2087/100027550). * Questions? Issue Status: 1. Open 2. **Started** 3. Submitted 4. Done 

<hr>

__Work has been started__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 264 years, 9 months from now.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [kaspars-gailitis](https://gitcoin.co/kaspars-gailitis) has been approved to start work.**

With my professional experience of integrating multiple different services and systems with APIs I would be  able to bring start to finish execution of this proposed problem. As I am still dipping my toes in crypto world this would be an amazing opportunity for me to dive deep into the problem space and come up with potential solutions and  an execution plan which could be completed step by step.

Initial execution plan:
1. Familiarise myself with Optimism product
2. Familiarise myself with LedgerLive product
3. Research similar integrations and competing products
4. Come up with potential solutions (pros and cons for each)
5. Create a detailed execution plan (if access to needed systems is permitted) for the chosen and approved approach.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-optimism/optimism/2087/100027550).

*DISCLAIMER as I am still very new to the crypto and web3 world there might be some inaccuracies. Feel free to correct me and provide me with more context* ## Optimism + Ledger integration Based on the available documentation there are multiple ways the integration could be achieved, these have been outlined as levels - the nigher the level the closer the integration and the better user experience. Level 2 and Level 3 integrations require Ledger review and approval before they can be released. ### Level 1 - App Connection This would allow users to use their Ledger to connect to [Optimism Gateway](https://gateway.optimism.io/). There are some SDK implementations details that would need to be researched more in detail and implemented within the app. The main issue with this would be that the Ledger doesn't support the Optimism network, so users would only be able to deposit the funds from the Ethereum Mainnet. This issue could be addressed with Level 3 integration. Alternatively, there could be UX and UI changes to disallow Withdrawing and to allow Depositing to a wallet which can be connected to Optimism network Ledger documentation - https://developers.ledger.com/docs/transport/overview/ ### Level 2 - Ledger Live application With this level the main advantage would be that the Optimism app could be displayed in the Ledger Live app browser. This level still has the same issue of not being able to use Optimism Network For Optimism there are two options on now to achieve this: 1. Integrating as a DApp 2. Integrating as a non-DApp The most user friendly and highest long term support would be to implement Optimism as a DApp. #### DApp integration From what I understood there isn't a hard requirement for the app to actually be a DApp, it mainly needs a web client (*Might be that I am misunderstanding something or missing some context*). This would allow a much closer integration and would remove the need for blind signing for Ledger users significantly improving the UX and trust. Additionally, with this integration if Optimism potentially provides an SDK, Optimism Ecosystem Apps could be surfaced within Ledger Live provided that the apps add support and interaction with the SDK. To implement this, there are requirements to create a Plugin which would essentially work as a bridge between the app and the the ledger. Ledger Documentation - https://developers.ledger.com/docs/dapp/nano-plugin/overview/ #### Non-DApp integration This would similarly allow the Optimism app to be surfaced on the Ledger Live App browser increasing discoverability. With the provided Ledger SDK integration would be seamless and would allow for the app to be used outside of the Ledger Live App browser. The main limitations of this would be that there is no future potentially to surface the Optimism Ecosystem apps and the provided SDK has some missing features, meaning that the users might still need to use blind signing for some features. Ledger Documentation - https://developers.ledger.com/docs/non-dapp/introduction/ ### Level 3 - Nano App With this integration level it would be possible to install the Optimism app and by extension the Optimism Network onto a Ledger, this would increase trust and would unlock all the Optimism provided features for Ledger users. Additionally all apps using the Optimism network could individually add support for Ledger. And with previously provided Levels this would work together to increase UX for Ledger users. Ledger Documentation - https://developers.ledger.com/docs/nano-app/introduction/ ### Conclusions With the outlined levels of integration there is a big opportunity to increase Ledger user experience. The outlined Levels can be worked on in parallel, but for non-supported features, such as fund withdrawal, there needs to be some sort of handling and user guides which would help users to understand the limitations and benefits. Main language being that users need to move the funds outside of Ledger and then back into the ledger to store them until there is Level 3 integration which would unlock all the provided Optimism Network capabilities. As some features loosely depend on other Level integrations (e.g. Level 2 integration requires web app updates to display the Ledger Wallet which could be achieved in Level 1), my main suggestion would be to develop this integration Level by Level this would allow us to identify any potential blockers and to pivot quickly in case of requirement changes. ## Next Steps: 1. Choose the initial Level of integration 2. Research the level requirements more closely 3. Create an tasks plan for the integration outlining potential pitfalls and areas where design and UX inputs are needed. 4. Approve the outlined plan 5. Start working on implementing the Ledger integration pivoting if needed.

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. Started 3. **Submitted** 4. Done
